result.execSummary:
The defendant Rigoberto Hernandez Benitez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all restitution/costs/fees, and no new law violations. If the Defendant violates any terms of his/her probation, or has any condition time imposed, the Court will deem that the conditions precedent necessary for the conditional grant of Expunction have not been met and therefore Expunction is denied. The defendant shall file a petition with the Court to verify the successful completion of the sentence.

records.addlTxt: filed by Attorney Andriusis regarding sentence credit
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Rigoberto Hernandez Benitez in court with attorney Julius Andriusis.  John Woodson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sarah Tapia appeared as interpreter.  Court questions defendant as to missed court appearance yesterday.  Defendant makes statement.  Attorney Andriusis is ready to proceed to trial.  They are not able to locate a victim.  State requests case is passed until they can speak to Attorney Osborne.  Court passes case.  

Case is recalled with the same appearances.  Parties have reached a resolution.    Defendant enters a plea of no contest as to Counts 2 and 3.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Count 1 is dismissed and read-in. Court conducts plea colloquy with defendant.  State makes sentencing argument.  Defense makes sentencing argument.  Defendant makes statement.  The Defendant was sentenced to the following:

IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

COUNT 2:

4 MONTHS HUBER with release for work

TERM OF PROBATION:  1 1/2 YEARS

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
*AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
*Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
*No violent contact with victim
*Domestic Violence counseling

COURT COSTS:  $243.00 (apply cash bail; refund balance to poster);

DNA SURCHARGE:  $200.00 (apply cash bail; refund balance to poster);
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

DOMESTIC VIOLENCE SURCHARGE:  $100.00 (apply cash bail; refund balance to poster)

CONDITION TIME: 60 days, STAYED; to be used at agent's discretion.  Agent to determine with or without non working hours.  



IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

COUNT 3:

55 DAYS HUBER with release for work.  Consecutive to Count 2.

TERM OF PROBATION:  1 1/2 YEARS concurrent

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
*AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
*Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
*No violent contact with victim
*Domestic Violence counseling

COURT COSTS:  $243.00 (apply cash bail; refund balance to poster);

DNA SURCHARGE:  $200.00 (apply cash bail; refund balance to poster);
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

DOMESTIC VIOLENCE SURCHARGE:  $100.00 (apply cash bail; refund balance to poster)


Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all restitution/costs/fees, and no new law violations. If the Defendant violates any terms of his probation, or has any condition time imposed, the Court will deem that the conditions precedent necessary for the conditional grant of Expunction have not been met and therefore Expunction is denied. The defendant shall file a petition with the Court to verify the successful completion of the sentence.

Defense to submit letter regarding sentencing credit.
